Hey guys,

Since I had to get some pics of this excellent Tachikanagushi I just 
got, I decided to try the same
experiment on it.  in the first picture, I used my skim lights, which I 
actually augmented with a third
light coming in at an angle coplanar with the lens:

http://home.teleport.com/~rkg/photos/tsuba/tachi_front_small.JPG

The next one is with the ringlight - note that this shows the achilles 
heel of these really well - shiny surfaces reflect the light
into the lens and wash it out:

http://home.teleport.com/~rkg/misc/tachi_front_ring_small.JPG

and last is my usual "scan" shot - note that I'd guess adjusting the 
brightness would get you to about what the first shot
looked like:

http://home.teleport.com/~rkg/misc/tachi_front_scan_small.JPG

Again, what I dislike about the scan is the loss of detail at the rim...

enjoy,

rkg
(Richard George)
